wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Charles Whitman (12 October 1860 – 2 February 1910) was a British print historian and museum curator, known for his books on the works of Valentine Green, Samuel William Reynolds, Samuel Cousins, and Charles Turner.

link_mentions.page: George Child Villiers, 6th Earl of Jersey
response: *Alfred Charles Whitman, Samuel Cousins' Nineteenth Century Mezzotinters section: V. The lettering of title slightly strengthened. B.M. 125. PEEL, MISS JULIA. After Sir T. Lawrence.
*Alfred Charles Whitman (1860–1910), English scholar in engravings
